intro: Zanonia indica var. orientalis, commonly known as the oriental zanonia, is a flowering plant belonging to the Malvaceae family. It is native to Southeast Asia and thrives in tropical and subtropical climates. The plant features palmate leaves with five to seven lobes and produces showy, yellow-orange flowers that bloom in clusters. It is often cultivated for its ornamental value due to its attractive foliage and vibrant blooms. The species is also valued in traditional medicine for its potential therapeutic properties.
